Posts.Content: On Jan 19, 2010 1:47 AM Charlote50 wrote: On Aug 10, 2009 12:00 AM Nancie wrote: I have been on Aromasin since Nov 09 and in Dec 09 had a torn miniscus repaired and now they want to do a knee replacement. I'm willing because the pain in my knee is constant and I want it gone. But, after reading in this site, I'm wondering if the aromasin is contributing to it. Any comments on that. Nancie I have been on arominsin for two years and in December I had scope surgery for a torn meniscus also.  He doens't want to do knee replacement .....but sometime I might have it.  I didn't know I had a torn meniscus, but had pain in my knees when I got up and walked ...it was that bad but annoying...the mri in nov. showed I had the torn place.  I wonder also if the aromasin causes all this pain.....etc......I fell terrible most of the time and my nerves have suffered lots also in the last few year.  I had a mastectomy in 77 and lost one breast and no chemo and then in sept 2005 a clump of cells barely there and had the other breast taken off and take the aromasin....I also am low on ViT D and take 50,000 once a week since a year ago and get check every 4 months.  I hope this web site can grow and we can see what these drugs are doing to us...I am 67 and live in Oklahoma....please write everyone who is one these drugs......there should be something else for us!! I am writing again....I had the surgery on my knee December 23, 2009....I have never had any knee pain etc.....for years and after taking this pill I feel it contributed to the undoing of my legs ....etc......I hope many of you write to me and post....thanks.   I made some typo mistakes in my last post from wrting too fast....thanks everyone ..we all need to stick together.......we are between a rock and a hard place at times in this situation I think.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: On Aug 10, 2009 12:00 AM Nancie wrote: I have been on Aromasin since Nov 09 and in Dec 09 had a torn miniscus repaired and now they want to do a knee replacement. I'm willing because the pain in my knee is constant and I want it gone. But, after reading in this site, I'm wondering if the aromasin is contributing to it. Any comments on that.
